text: Soe Thu (; ), born Soe Thu Lwin (; ; born on 30 November 1965) is a Burmese actor, singer, and physician. He won a Myanmar Academy Award. He became famous as an actor and singer. He has made 13 solo music albums and acted in more than 200 movies. He has achieved fame and success as an actor and singer. == Early life and education == Soe Thu was born on 30 November 1965 in Taungdwingyi, Myanmar. His father, Khin Maung Lwin, was an irrigation engineer, and his mother, Khin Thuzar, was a lawyer. He studied medicine and graduated from the University of Medicine 1, Yangon in 1996. == Career == Soe Thu started acting when director Ni Win Tun chose him for the movies Nantha Lu Chein and Pan Bu Chain. He became well-known in 1982 with the movie Maik Kyway Maik Pyit. In 1984, he released his first music album, Achit Ye Hmattan. He continued acting and singing until he moved to the United States in 2001. In the U.S., he works as a doctor at MedStar Southern Maryland Hospital Center and MedStar Washington Hospital Center. He returned to Myanmar in September 2012 to take care of his mother. Since then, he has performed solo concerts in Yangon and Mandalay. From 1983 to now, he has acted in over 200 films. == Personal life == Soe Thu was married to Khin Mya Mya Wutt Hmone Swe, and they have a daughter, Angel Soe Lwin. Since 22 May 2013, he has been dating actress Soe Myat Nandar. == Discography == # Achit Ye Hmattan (1984) # Myet Nar Phone (1987) # Kyo Pa Kwal (1990) # Sa Kyaw Tat (1991) # Thet Sone Tine (1992) # Ya That Pan (1993) # A Yine Lay (1995) # Ba Mhar Nay Le (1995) # Tha Ba Wa (1995) # Kyay Par Tot Hnit A Kaung Sone Tay Mya (1998) # Kyay Phyu Par Tot Ya That Pan (2000) # Kote Nay Thit Mya (2001) # A Myat No Sone Min A Kaung Lay (2015) == Filmography == # Maik Kyway Maik Pyit (1983) Soe Thu has acted in over 200 films. == References == Category:20th-century Burmese musicians Category:21st- century Burmese musicians Category:Living people Category:Cardiologists Category:Burmese actors Category:Burmese emigrants to the United States Category:People from Yangon Category:1965 births Category:20th-century singers Category:21st-century singers Category:Burmese singers
title: Soe Thu
